oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Carolina Country Style: Hosted by Doug Mayes: Tape 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is of a variety of interviews performed by Doug Mayes (host/personality) for WBT's Carolina Country Style radio program. The tape features interviews of George Jones (entertainer), Mary Reeves (entertainer), Bill Anderson (entertainer), Ernie Ashworth (entertainer), Jim Reeves (entertainer), Pearl Butler (entertainer), Tex Ritter (entertainer), Wesley Rose (entertainer), Bill Monroe (entertainer), Norma Jean (entertainer), Hank Williams Jr. (entertainer), June Carter (entertainer), Johnny Cash (entertainer), and the McCormick Brothers (musical group). Recordings are from a variety of unknown dates. The tape is the third of six tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Doug Mayes; George Jones; Mary Reeves; Bill Anderson; Ernie Ashworth; Jim Reeves; Pearl Butler; Tex Ritter; Wesley Rose; Bill Monroe; Norma Jean; Hank Williams Jr.; June Carter; Johnny Cash; The McCormick Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Doug Mayes praises George Jones, and both discuss Jones' popularity and writing -- (04:01) Mayes inquires about the future Jones envisions -- (04:31) Mayes introduces Mary Reeves, and Reeves reflects on the change in lifestyle Jim Reeve's success has created -- (07:45) Mayes reflects on his excitement to be hosting Bill Anderson; additionally, Anderson's recent achievements are reflected on -- (11:15) Mayes introduces Ernie Ashworth, and both reflect on Ashworth's awards -- (13:57) Mayes introduces Jim Reeves; additionally, Reeves reflects on what happens at a disc jockey awards show -- (17:00) Mayes discusses Pearl Butler's contribution to Carl Butler's musical career -- (22:16) Mayes introduces Tex Ritter to talk about Ritter's approach to recording -- (27:01) Mayes congratulates Wesley Rose; additionally, Rose reflects on being named: Man of the Year -- (28:40) Mayes introduces Bill Monroe, and both encapsulate what it is like to work in a bluegrass band -- (35:03) Mayes introduces Norma Jean to discuss her personal appearances with Porter Wagoner -- (39:42) Mayes introduces Hank Williams Jr.; additionally, Mayes inquires about how Williams Jr.'s work, at such a young age, will affect his future -- (43:13) Mayes introduces June Carter, and both reflect on Carter's time learning in areas such as New York -- (50:08) Mayes introduces Johnny Cash, and both reflect on appeal of recording to Cash -- (55:39) Mayes and the McCormick Brothers discuss how the McCormick Brothers' life had changed in recent years
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mayes, Doug; Jones, George; Jones, George, 1931-2013; Reeves, Mary, 1929-1999; Anderson, Bill; Anderson, Bill, 1937-; Ashworth, Ernie; Reeves, Jim; Butler, Pearl; Ritter, Tex; Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974; Rose, Wesley; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Jean, Norma; Williams, Hank, Jr., 1949-; Carter Cash, June; Carter, June; Cash, Johnny; McCormick Brothers;
